item.title: 年终阅读清单上的八本气候类书籍
item.description:
从希望的故事到绝望的故事，这些都是Bloomberg Green记者今年爱不释手的气候和环境读物。【原文：

From tales of hope to ones of despair, these are the climate and environmental reads that Bloomberg Green reporters couldn’t put down this year.

】

item.title: 尽管核聚变仍遥不可及，投资者为何仍将赌注押在核聚变上？
item.description: 核聚变长期以来一直吸引着科学界的想象力。人们的梦想是利用为恒星提供动力的相同过程来生产廉价、充足和无碳的电力。【原文：Nuclear fusion has long captured the scientific imagination. The dream is to harness the same process that powers stars to produce cheap, abundant and carbon-free electricity.】

item.title: 世界最大地球科学会议的五大收获
item.description: 今年，全球最大的地球科学会议背景令人震惊，特朗普政府宣布计划关闭一个标志性的气候研究实验室。可以说，这改变了会议的基调。【原文：The world’s biggest Earth science conference had a shocking backdrop this year, with the Trump administration announcing that it plans to close an iconic climate research lab. Suffice to say, that changed the tone of the gathering.】

item.title: 加州面临 2001 年以来最严重的雪灾之一
item.description:
温暖的冬季给西部各州带来的雨水多于积雪，而积雪是该地区供水的真正基础。【原文：

A warmer winter is bringing western states more rain than snow, the true foundation of the region’s water supply.

】

item.title: 周末假期前纽约遭遇狂风骤雨袭击
item.description: 强风和瓢泼大雨已经降临纽约市，增加了停电和沿海洪水的风险，美国最大的城市正在为周末假期做准备。【原文：Strong winds and drenching rain have descended on New York City, raising the risk of power outages and coastal flooding as the biggest US city prepares for the holiday weekend.】

item.title: 电动汽车销售增长放缓。混合动力车是解决方案吗？
item.description: 全球向零排放车辆转变的时间比预期的要长，这使得道路交通脱碳和缓解城市污染的努力变得更加复杂。汽车行业正在推动一种权宜之计：将传统内燃机与电池和电动马达相结合的混合动力汽车。【原文：A global shift toward zero-emission vehicles is taking longer than expected, complicating efforts to decarbonize road transport and alleviate urban pollution. The car industry is pushing a stopgap solution: hybrid vehicles that combine a traditional internal combustion engine with batteries and electric motors.】

item.title: 沃达丰为英国雨天预报改造移动数据
item.description: 手机上有各种天气应用程序，但现在，与用户保持联系的天线网络本身也正在成为一种预报工具。【原文：Mobile phones carry an array of weather apps, but now the network of antennas that keep users connected is emerging as a forecasting instrument in its own right.】

item.title: 科罗拉多大风将引发 "危险 "的火灾天气
item.description: 周五早些时候，科罗拉多州将面临 "特别危险 "的火灾天气，预计该州东部干枯山麓地区的阵风强度将达到飓风级别。【原文：Colorado will face “particularly dangerous” fire weather on early Friday with wind gusts expected to reach hurricane strength along parched foothills in the east of the state.】

item.title: 令人震惊的离职让伍德赛德失去了其关键的天然气冠军
item.description: 伍德赛德能源集团（Woodside Energy Group Ltd.首席执行官梅格-奥尼尔（Meg O'Neill）的离职让她的继任者进退两难：当预测显示液化天然气供应过剩、价格下降时，这家澳大利亚公司是否应该继续走她设定的道路，推动大规模的液化天然气项目？【原文：The surprise exit of Woodside Energy Group Ltd. Chief Executive Officer Meg O’Neill leaves her successor with a dilemma: should the Australian company continue down the path she set of promoting massive liquefied natural gas projects when forecasts point to a glut and lower prices?】

item.title: 日本执政党提议削减太阳能项目补贴
item.description: 日本执政党提议削减政府对大型太阳能项目的补贴，因为该党正努力在国家能源战略中减少对可再生能源的重视。【原文：Japan’s ruling party has proposed cutting government subsidies for large-scale solar projects, as it pushes to reduce emphasis on renewables in the nation’s energy strategy.】

item.title: House Passes Plan to Fast-Track Energy Projects, Sends to Senate
item.description: 共和党人提出的对发电厂、输油管道和其他能源及基础设施项目的联邦审批实行快速通道的计划周四在众议院获得通过，该措施将被送往参议院，并面临艰难的爬坡过程。【原文：Republicans’ plan to fast-track federal approvals of power plants, pipelines and other energy and infrastructure projects passed the House on Thursday, sending the measure to the Senate where it faces an uphill climb.】

item.title: 合成器流行乐队如何为世界电动汽车之都增添活力
item.description:
奥斯陆投入政府资金建设电动汽车基础设施。该市的充电主管解释了其回报情况。【原文：

Oslo invested government funds to build out its electric vehicle infrastructure. The city's charging czar explains how it's paid off.

】

item.title: 特朗普能否成功阻止他厌恶的美国风能产业？
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普憎恨风能。他的政府已经做出协调一致的努力来阻挠风能产业的发展。特朗普在今年 1 月重返白宫后数小时内就发布了一项指令，冻结了新的风能许可，并命令官员考虑终止现有租约。【原文：US President Donald Trump hates wind power. His administration has made a concerted effort to thwart the industry. Trump issued a directive within hours of his return to the White House in January that froze new permitting for wind energy and ordered officials to consider terminating existing leases.】

item.title: 美国计划拆除气候科学 "基石
item.description: 它被贴上了 "科学破坏 "和 "国家安全风险 "的标签。特朗普政府解散国家大气研究中心的计划激怒了科学家和政策制定者。【原文：It’s been labeled “scientific vandalism” and “a national security risk.” The Trump administration’s plan to dismantle the National Center for Atmospheric Research has outraged scientists and policymakers.】

item.title: 阿波罗扩展资产级风险审查，以反映极端天气的影响
item.description: 阿波罗全球管理公司（Apollo Global Management Inc.【原文：Apollo Global Management Inc. is building out its risk review process to reflect the impact on asset valuations of extreme weather.】

item.title: 日本因气候变化风险面临每人 6 美元的诉讼
item.description: 450 多人起诉日本政府，要求赔偿每人 1,000 日元（6 美元）的损失，声称世界上最大的温室气体排放国之一在应对全球变暖方面做得不够。【原文：More than 450 people are suing Japan’s government and seeking damages of 1,000 yen ($6) each, alleging one of the world’s top greenhouse gas emitters isn’t doing enough to combat global warming.】

item.title: 尽管面临金融危机，阿根廷仍大力发展可再生能源
item.description:
阿根廷能源部前副部长塞巴斯蒂安-金德（Sebastian Kind）解释了阿根廷如何为太阳能和风能的部署找到资金。【原文：

Sebastian Kind, former undersecretary in Argentina’s ministry of energy, explains how the country found the cash for solar and wind power deployment.

】

item.title: 报道称核反应堆将于 1 月重启，日本电力公司股价大涨
item.description: 有报道称，东京电力公司计划在 1 月份重启日本最大的核电站，该公司股价随之大涨 3%。【原文：Shares of Tokyo Electric Power Co. jumped as much as 3%, following reports that the utility is aiming to restart Japan’s largest nuclear power plant in January.】

item.title: 特朗普削减 76 亿美元能源项目引来联邦调查
item.description: 特朗普政府削减向加利福尼亚州和其他民主党领导的州提供的 76 亿美元拨款的举动引发了联邦监督机构的调查。【原文：The Trump administration’s move to cut $7.6 billion in grants to California and other Democratic-led states has prompted a probe by a federal watchdog.】

item.title: 科罗拉多州停电有可能使一些人数日处于黑暗之中
item.description: Xcel Energy 公司将于周三上午开始关闭科罗拉多州约 5 万名用户的用电，以降低大风吹倒电线和引发火灾的风险。【原文：Xcel Energy will begin shutting off electricity for about 50,000 customers in Colorado on Wednesday morning to lessen the risk that high winds will topple power lines and start fires.】

item.title: 西北太平洋地区短暂休整，周四风暴卷土重来
item.description: 在洪水和大风导致至少 60 万人停电、华盛顿州数百人被迫逃离家园并造成至少一人死亡之后，周三整个西北太平洋地区的降雨将有所缓解。【原文：Rain will ease Wednesday across the Pacific Northwest after floods and winds left at least 600,000 without power, forced hundreds of people in Washington to flee their homes and killed at least one person.】

item.title: 美国将解散关键研究机构，推进对气候问题的攻击
item.description: 美国计划解散国家大气研究中心，这是一个重要的气候科学机构，特朗普政府称其为环境激进主义的源头。【原文：The US plans to dismantle the National Center for Atmospheric Research, a key climate-science agency that the Trump administration is calling a source of environmental activism.】

item.title: 特朗普誓言称霸美国能源市场。他的表现如何
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）将联邦政府的全部力量都投入到他的大刀阔斧的计划中，支持化石燃料，削弱对风能和太阳能的支持，因此美国今年的石油产量将超过历史上任何其他国家。【原文：The US is on pace to pump more oil this year than any other nation in history as President Donald Trump puts the federal government’s full weight behind his sweeping agenda to champion fossil fuels and gut support for wind and solar.】

item.title: 国际能源署称全球煤炭需求停滞不前
item.description: 一份最新报告显示，全球煤炭需求正在停滞，并将在未来五年内逐渐下降。然而，我们是否已经真正达到了 "煤炭峰值"，这取决于中国。【原文：Global demand for coal is stalling and will gradually decline over the next five years, according to a fresh report. Whether we’ve truly hit “peak coal,” however, depends China.】

item.title: 如何赠送更环保的礼物
item.description:
这份节日礼物指南可以帮助您挑选新颖独特的礼物，并希望避免杂乱和浪费。【原文：

This holiday gift guide can help you pick original and unique presents — and hopefully avoid clutter and waste.

】

item.title: 当费率上升时，较贫穷的美国人放弃了联邦洪水保险
item.description:
一项新的研究发现，较高的价格更准确地反映了风险，但却促使低收入投保人外流。【原文：

Higher prices more accurately reflect risk but prompted an exodus of low-income policyholders, a new study finds. 

】

item.title: 福特取消与韩国 LG 公司价值 65 亿美元的电动汽车电池合同
item.description: 福特汽车公司取消了向 LG Energy Solution Ltd. 购买电池的 9.6 万亿韩元（65 亿美元）协议，因为这家美国汽车制造商放弃了其电动汽车目标。【原文：Ford Motor Co. canceled a 9.6 trillion won ($6.5 billion) agreement to purchase batteries from LG Energy Solution Ltd. after the US automaker rolled back its electric vehicle ambitions.】

item.title: 国际能源署称，到 2030 年煤炭需求将开始逐步下降
item.description: 国际能源机构称，随着可再生能源和液化天然气的发展，全球煤炭使用量已达到上限，并将在未来五年内开始缓慢下降。【原文：Global coal use has hit a ceiling and is set to begin a slow decline over the next five years as renewables and liquefied natural gas gain ground, the International Energy Agency said.】

item.title: 波兰通过首次拍卖打破欧洲海上风电的困境
item.description: 波兰将于周三启动其首次海上风电拍卖，在迅速退出煤炭市场以及欧洲其他国家取消招标的情况下，波兰将继续推进增加绿色能源生产的计划。【原文：Poland will on Wednesday kickstart its first offshore wind auction, pressing ahead with plans to ramp up green energy production amid a fast-approaching exit from coal and tender cancellations elsewhere in Europe.】

item.title: 客机是日本跟踪气候变化的最新工具
item.description: 日本最大的航空公司全日空控股公司（ANA Holdings Inc.【原文：ANA Holdings Inc., Japan’s largest airline, and the nation’s space agency are accelerating efforts to use sensors mounted on commercial jets to improve monitoring of greenhouse gas emissions.】
